moduleInfo.moduleTitle: Basic Theory and Practices/09 Strategy Pillars Topics Buckets/Complete Strategy Framework

overview.quote: Creating a strategy is like building your North Star – it guides every content decision and ensures you attract the right audience for the right reasons.
overview.introText: A successful short-form content strategy combines three key elements: pillars that define what you stand for, topics that connect with audience interests, and content buckets that create recognizable, repeatable formats viewers love.

keyTerms.definition: The 3-5 core themes or areas of expertise that define your brand and consistently appear across your content.
Repeatable video formats that combine pillars, topics and framing into recognizable 'shows' viewers come to expect.
Content distribution with 70% broad appeal, 20% focused educational, and 10% niche high-converting content.
The momentum gained when platforms recognize your content patterns and consistently show videos to the right audience.
Content structures (like listicles or reactions) that already perform well on social platforms.

actionPlan: Define 3-4 core pillars you want to be known for
Research 3 specific topics per pillar that people discuss
Combine topics with proven formats to create buckets
Create a content calendar using the 70-20-10 rule
Test buckets consistently before deciding their worth

mainContent.title: Start With Solid Pillars
mainContent.text: Your pillars are your foundation – the 3-4 themes you want to be known for. They should reflect your authentic interests while having enough appeal to attract an audience. A unique combination sets you apart from competitors.

summaryPoints: Ensure each has depth for ongoing content
Be someone with interests, not just a niche

mainContent.title: Connect Through Topics
mainContent.text: Topics bridge your pillars to your audience's interests. Research subreddits, comment sections, and forums to find what people actually discuss. Focus on problems, questions, and trends where your perspective adds unique value.

mainContent.title: Create Recognizable Buckets
mainContent.text: Content buckets = Pillars × Topics ÷ Pre-validated Framing. They're your repeatable 'shows' that make creation easier and help viewers know what to expect. Test multiple videos in each bucket before judging performance.

summaryPoints: Use formats that already work on platforms

mainContent.title: Balance Your Content Mix
mainContent.text: Apply the 70-20-10 rule when starting out: 70% broad/entertaining content to attract viewers, 20% focused content to build trust, and 10% niche content for conversions. This creates a natural audience funnel.

summaryPoints: Adjust ratios as your account grows

proTips.text: Save your strongest calls-to-action for your 10% niche content where viewers are already highly engaged with your message.
Viewers remember your 'bucket' before they remember your name – consistency in formats builds recognition faster than branding.

finalWords.description: Planning your framework first makes every content decision easier later on!
